reasoning: Reporting prevalence (existing cases), not incidence. Adenomatous polyps are benign precursor lesions found in ~25-30% of adults over age 50 (25,000 per 100k). Prevalence is the appropriate metric for this chronic, often asymptomatic condition.
source: Lieberman DA et al. (2000). Prevalence of polyps greater than 9 mm in a consortium of diverse geographic areas. Clin Gastroenterol Hepatol. 3(8):798-805
